The plant features small, bright yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, often with a pink or rose-colored hue, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Fagonia harpago f. roseiflora is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to xerophytic conditions.
